I have been thinking about a phablet for quite awhile and have been researching them extensively
I was looking for a no contract phone,and had been looking at the Boost ZTEMax

Then as I was watching TV last weekend I happened upon QVC when they were showing the HTC Desire 816 and I was hooked!I immediately checked to see if Amazon had it and they do, for $10 cheaper so I ordered it
Am I glad I found it
it is a fantastic phone!!I wanted a phablet because of the larger size, the old eyes aren't what they use to be, and I find the 5
5 screen is perfect
The build quality is very nice, it doesn't feel cheap at all and it feels great in my hand
It offers so much more than the Boost Max and is much less expensive
Everything about it works great, it is quad core so it is super fast
The speakers are unbelieveable, crisp, clear and loud
The screen is also great, crisp and clear, hd
Apps download fast with no problem
There is no lag at all
The battery life is terrific, I have been using it for 2 days, heavily and haven't had to charge it yet
It had to be fully charged when it first arrived and it charged in about 3-4 hours
Activation to Virgin Mobil was a breeze, took about 15 minutes
I chose the $35 a month plan with 300 minutes of talk time and unlimited text and data
Can't beat that!And I chose auto pay so I don't need to worry about when to pay each month, it is done automatically
I am thrilled with my new phone/phablet
I highly recommend it to anyone who is in the market for a phablet or is looking to upgrade to a high end phone
Do not hesitate this is a fabulous choice!

I have a home phone in my office, as well as a business line
I had to do some faxing recently and plugged my home phone line into my fax
I never took it out, because now I only use my cell phone
Seriously thinking of discontinuing my home phone service altogether
I had the $35 a month planwhich only gives you 200 talk minutes, but you still get unlimited text and data
For a recent vacation I upped my talk plan to Unlimited for the extra $20 per month since I was sure to need more talk time, but left it at that plan once I came back
You are not locked in to how much you wanna talk
Say your budget only allows for you to have the $35 plan, but you're going home for Christmas and need to use your phone more
Add an extra 20 bucks for that month, and you're at unlimited talk
When you come back, change it back to stick to your budget
The one con I have with Virgin Mobile phones is that you are locked into only purchasing dedicated Virgin Mobile phones
No Sim Cards, however, THIS PHONE, does have an actual removable Sim Card
At this point I am not sure if I could get a T-Mobile sim Card under their Bring you own phone planbut the fact that the sim card is removable, suggests its possible to take it to another carrier
But I am not leaving Virgin Mobile to find out

The Virgin Mobile version of this phone is NOT Dual SIM
This is not a huge issue to me, but I was looking forward to utilizing both SIM slots
There is a rubber plug covering the second SIM slot
I pulled it off and found the position for the slot, but no actual SIM slot behind the plug
There is a reason why the VM version of this phone is less expensive that other carriers versions of this phone
Not a big deal to me
I am TOTALLY satisfied upgrading from my almost 4 years old LG to this current MODERN cell phone
Please remember my bias when considering my review for this phone

5-inches HD display in one hand or in my pocket, just like a friend’s iPhone Xs

I bought this phone as a GPS and Wifi device mostly for my motorcycle, so my review doesn't cover cell phone and carrier specific items
I think many people that look at this phone might also be looking at the Armor X series for a rugged phone, and I had both the WP5 and an Armor X7 and did a comparison
I set it up both and ran them side by side for battery, photos, GPS, and overall usage
Battery life is crazy good (compared to iPhones)
We've taken to calling it the lead brick around my house
It's definitely rugged and feels that way
Raised edges on the screen side mean you can use it without a case and set it face down on a table without worrying
GPS seemed to be spot on as well
Also compared to my Fitbit Ionic GPS, and it was matching my Strava tracks for the same route too
Brightness was good
If I was carrying it around in my hand all day, it might get tiring
But it's truly a 5 day battery life kinda phone even with a lot of usage
I was worried it was too big at first and thought the X7 was a better fit, but the other pros outweight the weight and size con significantly
I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for big battery life and a smooth Android experience in a very rugged package

Good and honest value
I bought this phone to replace a moto g6 because its battery would soon need replacement, a time and labor intensive task
I give it 4 stars because it meets my needs

There are important pros compared to the g6, it actually has a speaker, it has a button on the side (which is close to useless because of limited software), gps easily finds satellites, it links easily and well to bluetooth earpieces and stays connected even at long ranges
Phone volumes are good as are ringtone volumes
I have seen reviews that said it had been difficult to get a 4g connection to AT&T
I had no difficulty at all
There are downsides
The instruction manual is useless
There is no selfie light
The rubber plug that keeps the usb-c port dry can't be put back (the manual should explain how)
The screen, great if compared to a 2008 phone, is inferior looking compared to the g6
The worst thing for me is that sometimes swiping up fails to answer calls
A useful feature for that button would be to answer calls
Not having a selfie light or some other light on the front makes it hard to find out that a call or text has been missed
If I need another phone, I'd be likely to look at Oukitel again
Good phone.  Awful camera.
I didn't buy this phone with the expectation of it having a great camera
I didn't even expect a good camera
What I didn't expect was a worthless camera that refused to focus on anything
Trying to take a photo of anything is a maddening experience
That being said, it does everything else pretty good
I work outside in a harsh environment, so I wanted a durable phone that could handle the elements
That's where this phone shines
I get 3 days out of a single charge (with moderate use)
At this price point, this is a decent and durable phone
If it had a functional camera I would give it 5 stars
The phone will intermittently restart itself for no reason , mostly at inconvenient times
It also refuses to display the weather from my weather app
and the camera still is horrible
I know these are minor things, and at the phones price point I cannot fairly compare it to a flagship device
That being said, there are probably better phones out there for $150
Lacks band 12/17 as stated from seller.
The add on Amazon states phone hasbands FDD-LTE: 2/4/5/7/12/17/28a/28b
This phone will NOT work on ATT's LTE network
When I am outside of WCDMA coverage the phone will not make/receive calls
I have no complaints with the phone quality
Underwhelming battery life and camera, but overall a solid buy thus far
The phone feels solid and I hope it lasts, which is the main reason I bought it

Performance wise it's about what I expected: I do like that the phone is very clear on how much RAM is being used and till what time the battery will last, although the battery estimates are far from accurate
BEYOND Expectations SEE UPDATE W/PROBLEMS
This phone is definitely worth the money
It is surprisingly heavy, definitely rugged
After about 2 weeks of playing with it, the weight isn't as noticeable
I did get a screen protector for additional durability
It does not need a case
Upon receiving this phone, my old Android transfered with absolutely no problems (I used my Google Account and it guided me right through the whole process quick and easy)
This phone simply prompts you along the way of completely setting it up
Phone service was up and running automatically within minutes of turning the phone on after inserting my old Nano SIM Card
The Wi-Fi works great (works faster than my old phone)
I played with the camera and video and had no issues with it although you may want to download a new camera/video app if you want more features available to you
I spent a good 4 hours straight on the phone's internet and different apps and it only went down to 87% (my other phone would have been long dead in that time)
It charges with the included C type cord and it seems to charge pretty quick (87% to 100% within about 30 minutes or less)
One of the Big factors for me is the call quality and this phone is great! Calls sound crisp, loud and clear both on my side and the receivers side
I love the 4 GB RAM (faster and more productive than my old 2 GB RAM phone)
Noticeable difference
You can keep a number of apps open at the same time with no phone lagging problems and it clearly tells you how many more GB of RAM are still available to you with certain apps open
The 32 GB internal memory is very nice (another upgrade from my old phone) and there is NOT a bunch of bloatware on the phone, you have maybe 22-26 GB of pure internal memory that is all yours
I have only used the Pattern Unlocking Screen (no fingerprint or face recognition has been used)
It connects to my carrier great with an impressive signal strength and data speed running on the 4G

Only 2 areas that I have noticed so far that I wish were improved is I wish the screen size was bigger (although it is exactly the same size as my old phone, I just wish it was bigger) and I wish there was a notification (blinking or flashing) light on the phone to indicate you have a new SMS
I have shown this phone to other people and it is well received
My GF wants one now
All you have to do is write a review (good or bad) and email the company a screen shot of your review and they will send it right to you
They are very responsive to your email
I bought the additional 2 year warranty
It basically covers anything that could happen to the phone and takes over when your initial limited warranty that comes with the phone expires
The additional warranty even covers things the initial limited warranty doesn't cover all from the time you get your new phone
For example, if you somehow crack your screen it is fully covered from day one with the extended warranty
Amazon sponsors the extended warranty through Asurion Protection Plan
It even covers FREE technical support
I would definitely purchase this phone again if I was looking to replace another Android
This phone is a gem
THIS REVIEW WAS NOT WRITTEN TO IMPRESS ANYONE OR ANY COMPANY FOR COMPENSATION OR ANYTHING ELSE
I WROTE THIS REVIEW FROM MY OWN PERSONAL EXPERIENCE AND IMPRESSION OF THIS OUKITEL W5 PHONE
I have tried all the recommended steps to speed back up the internet including clearing my internet cache with no improvement
It does this using WiFi and using just my 4G Data (with 4 bars of signal)
I don't know what the problem is
This month (FIVE MONTHS AFTER BUYING THE CELL PHONE), I am noticing not only the slow internet, but the battery won't charge to 100%
Using one battery cord, it will only charge to 84% and using other cords to test it out, it will only charge to 94%

I have tried everything recommended including running a battery tester/diagnotic (which said that the battery is good), restarting the phone, cleaning the charger connector to the phone and (as mentioned before) different chargers with no improvement
The battery even seems to run down faster

The last that was recommended to try is resetting the phone back to manufacturer settings for which I have NOT tried due to how long it takes to set everything up again even using my Google Back-up files
I'll update you if or when I reset the phone
Despite getting the warranty, I have not contacted them yet with the problems of the slow internet or not charging to 100%
It is all frustrating and unexpected with this seemingly quality phone
Everything else still works great, but, because of these new problems I have dropped my rating of the phone from 5 stars to 3 stars
Don't miss out on this phone! You will love it ...

Great phone for the price
We are very happy with this phone
This is our second Studio 5
Battery life is very good and all the accessories that come with it (screen shield, gel cover) are nice, you don’t have to go out and spend the extra for items I feel are a necessity
Dual sims are overkill for our use, SD storage up to 32 GB is handy
Processor and RAM work for a phone at this price point, I’ve read other reviews complaining about this but it is commensurate with the level of phone/$$
End user likes that it is running KitKat
The only negatives which are minor are more my preferences
The manual that came with the phone had the Spanish portion in the front and English in the back
Another is the capacitive display, I just don’t prefer that type of screen but the display is crisp and bright for this price point
It seems more retailers on Amazon are using this and the USPS is subpar with keeping items tracking updated if available at all
Otherwise the shipping went off without a problem
If your looking for a phone that has a lot to offer and doesn't break the bank, this is a good choice

Got this for my mother to finally get her off an old flip phone
Did not want to spend a lot because I wasn't sure I could sell her on it
I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the box
I have been using cell phones since 1984 so, as you might imagine, I have bought A LOT of phones
This phone had, by far, the best packaging I have ever seen on a cell phone
This gave me a good feeling about the phone from the beginning
The battery was almost fully charged so I was able to start setting it up right away
Setup was simple and straight forward
Within minutes I was making calls
The basic Android 4
2 was a pleasure; no bloatware or strange interface
Now for the test; could my 83 year old mother learn to use it
She was afraid of it from the start but within minutes she was making calls and sending text messages
She had a lttle trouble getting the concept of how to add names and numbers to her hotmail contact list but I worked with her a bit and told her to play with it overnight
I just got a call from her this morning and she proudly told me that she had successfully addedphone numbers for most of her friends and relatives
She finally admitted that she might learn to like it

Not too bad for the price...
So I have spenta few days with this phone now
The local phone shops are selling these phones for twice this
I do have a few grips though
So my first complaint is the screen
Resolution aside, knowing I was getting a lower resolution device (basically 480P kind of resolution) I wasn't too upset with that, but yeah it's bad

The viewing angle is where the issue is, if you're not looking at it dead on, the image looks like the typical old schoolLCD, where the colors are inverted, but the image quality even dead on is kind of washed out,but the touch screen is really where this phone wins no love with me
This complaint is a short one, but it's the front camera, the resolution is horrible, especially if the light is indoor
I also have to report that the sound through the earphone jack is not great, there is just no bass, I have heard equal soundquality from those cheap radios they give away for contests, and such

My last complaint is really not an issue that most users will even care about, but this phone is near impossible to root, considering this phone I'm sure is not on anyone's favorites list, and therefore development on this phone is practically non existantPros:Low cost solution for an immediate replacementDecent battery life

When my S3 died a couple of weeks ago (I am not one that has to have the latest and greatest of anything
Rhonda is what my son calls the voice guidance in Google Maps

When my S3 died a couple of weeks ago (I am not one that has to have the latest and greatest of anything; when I buy something I use it until it falls part), I didn't want to buy an expensive phone right away
I only really use my phones for web searches, facebook checking, making phone calls, texting
But I depend heavily on my Google maps, more than anything else
The phone is fine with the other stuff, but all we ever hear Rhonda say is:GPS signal lost
Every once in a while, she assures me I'm on the fastest route, THEN tells me the GPS signal is lost
Those are the only two things Rhonda has ever said to us

When I look at the phone maps display, the phone is often stuck on the last turn it honed in on, even though it seems like we are making progress, and the route is usually way off the actual road we are on
Then the phone reboots
This only happens with Google maps
And it happens each and every time
There are never any good days
And this was never an issue with my S3
This alone is enough for me to say I will NEVER buy another Blu phone
If my phone says it has a GPS system, I kind of assume it means it functions
You get what you pay for LOL, that's for sure!
